		</div>
				
<div class="nav-donate">
	<a href="https://donate.wikimedia.org/?utm_medium=wmfSite&#038;utm_campaign=navButton&#038;uselang=en&utm_source=140" class="nav-donate__link">
			<svg class="i icon icon-lock nav-donate__icon nav-donate__icon--lock">
		<use xlink:href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/themes/shiro/assets/dist/icons-76a7eb51c2.svg#lock"></use>
	</svg>
				<svg class="i icon icon-heart nav-donate__icon nav-donate__icon--heart">
		<use xlink:href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/themes/shiro/assets/dist/icons-76a7eb51c2.svg#heart"></use>
	</svg>
			<span class="nav-donate__copy">
			Donate now		</span>
	</a>
</div>
	</div>
</div>
		<div class="header-inner mw-980">
			<nav class="primary-nav">
	<div class="primary-nav__drawer" data-dropdown-content="primary-nav">
		<div class='nav-search nav-search--mobile'>
			<form role="search" method="get" class="search-form" action="https://wikimediafoundation.org/">
	<label class="search-form__label">
		<span class="screen-reader-text">Search for:</span>
		<input type="search" class="search-form__field"
			   placeholder="Search site"
			   value="" name="s"
			   title="Search for:" />
	</label>
	<button type="submit" class="search-form__button">
		<span class="screen-reader-text">Search</span>
			<svg class="i icon icon-search search-form__icon">
		<use xlink:href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/themes/shiro/assets/dist/icons-76a7eb51c2.svg#search"></use>
	</svg>
		</button>
</form>
		</div>
		<ul id="menu-header-menu" class="primary-nav__items"><li id="nav-menu-item-123" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/our-work/"><span>Our Work</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-115" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/support/"><span>Support Wikipedia</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-119" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/research/"><span>Research</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-118" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/advocacy/"><span>Advocacy</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-117" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/technology/"><span>Technology</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-28" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/news/"><span>News</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-116" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/participate/"><span>Participate</span></a></li>
<li id="nav-menu-item-120" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-page-ancestor"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/about/"><span>About</span></a></li>
</ul>	</div>
</nav>
			

<div class="header-main">

<div class="header-content">

	<!-- Top back link -->
		<h2 class="h4 eyebrow">
				<a class="back-arrow-link" href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/about/">
					About				</a>
			</h2>
	
	<!-- Blog home  -->
	
	<!-- Site front page -->
	
			<!-- h1 or title as heading -->
					<h1>
				Work with us			</h1>
					
		<!-- h2 and title, without image -->
		
		<!-- h2 and title, with image -->
			
	
	
	</div>

</div>

</div>
</header>

<main id="content">


<div class="mw-980 mod-margin-bottom">
	
<div class="sidebar-float">
	
	</div>
	<div class="article-main wysiwyg">
		
<h3 class="wp-block-heading is-style-default" id="make-the-internet-a-better-place-for-free-knowledge">Make the internet a better place for free knowledge.</h3>



<div class="wp-block-shiro-toc-columns">
<div class="wp-block-columns toc__section is-layout-flex wp-container-3 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
<div class="wp-block-column toc__sidebar is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:30%">	<nav
		class="toc-nav"
		data-backdrop="inactive"
		data-dropdown="toc-nav"
		data-dropdown-content=".toc"
		data-dropdown-status="uninitialized"
		data-dropdown-toggle=".toc__button"
		data-sticky="false"
		data-toggleable="yes"
		data-trap="inactive"
		data-visible="false"
	>
		<h2 class="toc__title screen-reader-text">
			Table of Contents		</h2>
		<button aria-expanded="false" class="toc__button" hidden>
			<span class="btn-label-a11y">
				Navigate within this page.			</span>
			<span class="btn-label-active-item">
				Advancement			</span>
		</button>
		<ul class="wp-block-shiro-toc table-of-contents toc">
				<ul class="wp-block-shiro-toc table-of-contents toc">
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-1">Advancement</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-2">Communications</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-4">Finance and Administration</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-5">Legal</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-8">Product &amp; Technology</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-7">Talent and Culture</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-9">Values</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-10">Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Commitment</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-11">Equal Employment Opportunity Statement</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-12">United States Benefits and Perks</a>
					</li>
				<li class="toc__item">
			<a class="toc__link" href="#section-13">Applicant Privacy Policy</a>
					</li>
			</ul>
			</ul>
	</nav>
	</div>



<div class="wp-block-column toc__content is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:70%">
<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-1">Advancement</h2>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a2-"><a href="https://grnh.se/d93c23471us">Planned Giving Officer (Principal level role)</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a2-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Planned Giving Officer will serve as a front-line fundraiser on a team charged with securing annually increasing revenue targets through major, planned, and blended gifts. This newly created high-level role will report to the Director of Major Gifts and Planned Giving (MG&amp;PG) and will bring an increased depth of planned giving expertise to the department. The MG&amp;PG team also includes a senior planned giving specialist, a part-time planned giving contractor, and three major gift officers, in addition to other members of the broader Major Gifts, Foundations, and Endowment team who support functions such as prospect research, stewardship, and events.&nbsp;</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a2-"><a href="https://grnh.se/7e1f8cf51us">Dutch Translator (Part-Time Contract)</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a2-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Fundraising team runs annual fundraising campaign in the Netherlands. The team requires a linguist experienced in translation and translation review/proofreading to help translate from English to Dutch. The linguist will also help proofread banner and email content.&nbsp;This will be an ongoing contract working on translating campaigns 0-15 hours a week.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading"><a href="https://grnh.se/04be7c2d1us">Staff Site Reliability Engineer</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a Staff Site Reliability Engineer to join our team, reporting to the Sr. Engineering Manager. As the Site Reliability Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining reliable, scalable, and highly available infrastructure for our API services. You will contribute heavily to the high impact challenges behind innovating, building, and maintaining Wikipedia’s data feeds for high volume reusers.&nbsp;</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-2">Communications</h2>



<p>Check back soon!</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-4">Finance and Administration</h2>



<p>Check back soon!</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-5">Legal</h2>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a5-"><strong><a href="https://grnh.se/7b9e68091us">Lead Counsel (Content Compliance and Strategic Litigation)</a></strong></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a5-">Remote</h5>



<p>As Wikimedia pursues our <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RpPnuSvCJLY">global strategic direction</a>, our Legal department is tasked with solving many legal questions, including some that no one has fully considered before. We are looking for an experienced lawyer with interest and experience in matters relating to online content and public policy to join our in-house legal department as Lead Counsel.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-8">Product &amp; Technology</h2>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-product-manager"><a href="https://grnh.se/f0af32e21us">Product Manager, Mobile Apps</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-remote">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a collaborative Product Manager for the Mobile Apps team in our Product and Technology department. The Product and Technology department builds the wiki experiences that enable our communities to achieve our vision: a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. This is an opportunity to have a tremendous impact with one of the most beloved parts of the internet.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-site-reliability-engineer-iii,-observability"><a href="https://grnh.se/506163cb1us">Site Reliability Engineer III, Observability</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-">Remote</h5>



<p>Wikimedia Foundation is hiring a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our SRE team, where we take care of the infrastructure that runs wikipedia.org and other Wikimedia Foundation projects. We are responsible for the entire infrastructure stack, from multiple data centers through networking and interconnects to thousands of servers and the application stack that runs on them.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-"><a href="https://grnh.se/5743efa61us">Lead Community Tech Manager</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation is an inclusive employer, and we are looking for a Lead Community Tech Manager with experience of product development,&nbsp; technical support processes, and user engagement&nbsp; to join our team, reporting to the Product and Technology leadership.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-senior-data-engineer"><a href="https://grnh.se/5f9de8761us">Senior Data Engineer</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building, maintaining, and expanding the shared data infrastructure that supports insights, research, and new data products, in the Foundation as well as the Wiki Movement. This includes everything from building scalable pipeline infrastructure, and working on the event streaming platform to providing scalable data-serving solutions.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-"><a href="https://grnh.se/93f208af1us">Director of Engineering, Developer Experience</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Director of Engineering, Developer Experience is accountable for the Developer Experience Group in the Wikimedia Foundation and is an active participant in the strategic decision making for the Product and Technology department and across the Wikimedia movement. The Developer Experience Group includes Release Engineering, Cloud Services, Technical Documentation, and Quality &amp; Test Engineering teams. This role shares responsibility with the Director of Product for Developer Experience to develop and execute a holistic strategy for Developer Experience in collaboration with other engineering teams, product management, and the volunteer technical contributor community. The teams in this group develop and deliver software, services, and processes that build and sustain our engineering culture and foster improved collaboration. This role is a people management role responsible for completion of technical objectives and a key partner to their Director of Product counterpart.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-director-of-site-reliability-engineering"><a href="https://grnh.se/ee9223121us">Director of Site Reliability Engineering</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a6-remote">Remote</h5>



<p>We are strengthening the team and looking for a Director of SRE to lead our staff and ensure teams achieve our goals. Wikimedia Foundation’s Site Reliability Engineering team is responsible for ensuring our global top-10 web site and other public facing services are healthy, and developing its infrastructure, platform and services further in the enablement of Wikimedia Foundation’s mission. The SRE team comprises over 45 creative and talented staff members who are globally distributed, organized into seven teams each with their own scope and focus area.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading"><a href="https://grnh.se/6a9b29501us">Site Reliability Engineer III (Traffic)</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading">Remote</h5>



<p>As an engineer in the SRE team, you will be involved in defining and running the infrastructure and services that form the base of Wikimedia Foundation projects. This will include frequent work with other members of the SRE team to improve our infrastructure in terms of scalability, high availability, recoverability, monitoring and logging.&nbsp;</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading"><a href="https://grnh.se/aae3b0fb1us">Senior Site Reliability Engineer</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading">Remote</h5>



<p>Wikimedia Foundation is hiring a Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our Service Operations SRE team, where we take care of the infrastructure that runs wikipedia.org and other Wikimedia Foundation projects. The SRE team at Wikimedia is a distributed and diverse team of engineers with a drive to explore, experiment and embrace new technologies. The SRE Service Operations team focuses on the application layer of our complex infrastructure as well as our developer-facing services.&nbsp;</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-7">Talent and Culture</h2>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a7-"><a href="https://grnh.se/5b3ca81e1us">Specialist, Global Compensation and People Analytics (Contract)</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a7-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a Specialist, Global Compensation and People Analytics to join our Global People Operations team. This global role is critical for our salary and compensation planning process across more than 40 countries and serves as an escalation point to support the recruiters and staff. Additionally, the role is responsible for the development and maintenance of the HR metrics and People Analytics dashboards specifically targeted at providing people insights to the organization.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a7-"><a href="https://grnh.se/b7ac546d1us">Strategy &amp; Administration Specialist &#8211; Talent &amp; Culture</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a7-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Strategy and Administration Specialist &#8211; Talent &amp; Culture (T&amp;C) will support the T&amp;C leadership team by facilitating department-wide projects and enabling successful progress towards launching new T&amp;C initiatives. Reporting to the Chief Talent &amp; Culture Officer (CTCO), they will be hyper-organized to ensure activities are coordinated and streamlined within the department based on the priorities of the department’s sub-teams including DEI (Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion), Learning &amp; Development (L&amp;D), People Operations, Recruiting and Human Resource Business Partners (HRBP) functions. Further, this role will provide the foundational support needed to increase collaboration, communication and transparency between T&amp;C staff and other WMF staff. They will also seek to help keep T&amp;C subteams aligned with our departmental and organizational OKR goals and team priority roadmaps.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="a7-"><a href="https://grnh.se/fba47b691us">Vice President, Global Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</a></h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="a7-">Remote</h5>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation’s vision is to “imagine a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.” We feel obligated to not only cultivate an environment that is equitable and inclusive for our staff, but one that reflects the diversity of who we serve in communities all over the world.<br>The VP, Global Diversity, Equity and Inclusion plays a central and vital role in defining and evolving both culture and metrics at the Wikimedia Foundation. The position requires both big-picture, strategic thinking as well as on-the-ground operational skills to set targets and mobilize action in all aspects of diversity, equity, and inclusion.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-9">Values</h2>



<p><strong>We are in this mission together</strong></p>



<p><strong>We do great work and improve</strong></p>



<p><strong>We welcome everyone who shares our Vision and Values</strong></p>



<p><strong>We listen and share with curiosity</strong></p>



<p><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/about/values/">Read more</a> about our values.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-10">Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Commitment</h2>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="our-diversity-and-inclusion-path"><em><strong>Our diversity and inclusion path</strong></em></h4>



<p><strong>We trust our personal and organizational accountability</strong></p>



<p><strong>We envision</strong>&nbsp;a world in which every single person can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe knowledge belongs to everyone, and in order to empower people from diverse backgrounds to participate in the collaborative creation of knowledge, we need to build diverse teams that reflect the communities we support and an inclusive culture of belonging that embraces the potential of our diversity.</p>



<p><strong>We believe</strong>&nbsp;in co-creating safe, respectful and collaborative work spaces. We aspire to generate a sense of belonging by understanding each and everyone’s differences, contexts and experiences. Through our actions, we ensure that the staff at the Foundation has a healthy work environment where they can flourish.</p>



<p><strong>We acknowledge</strong>&nbsp;diversity as a core value that is essential to fulfilling our mission.</p>



<p>We are an&nbsp;<a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/about/jobs/">equal opportunity employer</a>&nbsp;and do not tolerate any form of discrimination. This enables us to attract, develop, and retain amazing talent.</p>



<p><strong>We are committed</strong>&nbsp;to cherishing our differences, and putting people first. We seek to foster a creative environment that unleashes innovative solutions toward building&nbsp; a more inclusive and equitable hiring and retention process. This commitment starts at the top of our organization and moves through every level of hiring from managers to individual contributors. We strive to ensure excellence in our work by building this path together.</p>



<p>We have released two Diversity and Inclusion Reports (<a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/news/2019/10/01/wikimedia-foundation-diversity-and-inclusion-information-about-our-workers-2019-by-the-numbers/">2018</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/news/2018/08/30/diversity-inclusion-numbers/">2019</a>) to hold ourselves accountable for our actions towards creating a more diverse and inclusive workplace. This practice helps us to make visible not only our progress, but also the areas where we know we should and will improve.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-11">Equal Employment Opportunity Statement</h2>



<p>As an equal opportunity employer, the Wikimedia Foundation values having a diverse workforce and continuously strives to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace. We encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate against any person based upon their race, traits historically associated with race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics.</p>



<p>If you are a qualified applicant requiring assistance or an accommodation to complete any step of the application process due to a disability, you may contact us at recruiting@wikimedia.org or +1 (415) 839-6885.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-12">United States Benefits and Perks</h2>



<p><strong>Health Care Benefits</strong></p>



<p>Fully paid medical, dental, and vision insurance premiums for employees and their eligible families.</p>



<p><strong>New Parent Leave</strong></p>



<p>We provide a total of 16 weeks of paid new parent leave, plus an additional 8 weeks of paid pregnancy leave.</p>



<p><strong>Wellness Reimbursement Program</strong></p>



<p>We provide $450 per quarter up to $1,800.00 a year for reimbursement for staff wellness expenses, such as gym fees, educational expenses, and more!</p>



<p><strong>Professional Development Program</strong></p>



<p>We offer reimbursement of conferences, college/university classes, online programs, and books related to work that supports the Wikimedia Foundation.</p>



<p><strong>401(k) Retirement Plan</strong></p>



<p>401(k) retirement plan with matched contributions up to 4% of annual salary.</p>



<p><strong>Time Off</strong></p>



<p>Generous paid time off policy which includes: vacation days, holidays, sick leave, and volunteer days. </p>



<p><strong>Pre-tax Savings Plans</strong></p>



<p>For health care, child care, elder care, public transport, and parking expenses. Includes an employer funded HSA option.</p>



<p><strong><strong>Disability &amp; Life Insurance</strong></strong></p>



<p>Long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program.</p>



<p><strong>Equipment Stipend</strong></p>



<p>Equipment including a laptop, monitor, plus a one-time $600 stipend to cover any additional needs to make sure you have the best work from home experience.</p>



<p><strong><em>*Please note that for remote roles located outside of the U.S., we defer to our EOR (Employer of Record) to ensure alignment with local labor laws.</em></strong></p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="section-13">Applicant Privacy Policy</h2>



<p>The Wikimedia Foundation (&#8220;<strong>Wikimedia</strong>&#8220;) values your trust and is committed to the responsible management, use and protection of personal information. This Applicant Privacy Policy (&#8220;<strong>Policy</strong>&#8220;) describes our practices regarding the information that we collect in connection to your application for a job or internship with Wikimedia.</p>



<p>Learn more about our&nbsp;<a href="https://foundation.wikimedia.org/wiki/Applicant_privacy_policy">Applicant Privacy Policy</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>



<div class="wp-block-shiro-spotlight spotlight alignfull is-style-donate-red90"><div class="spotlight__inner"><div class="spotlight__content"><h2 class="spotlight__heading is-style-h1">Help us unlock the world’s knowledge.</h2><p class="spotlight__text">As a nonprofit, Wikipedia and our related free knowledge projects are powered primarily through donations.</p><a class="spotlight__cta" href="https://donate.wikimedia.org/?utm_medium=wmfSite&amp;utm_campaign=homeButton&amp;uselang=en">Donate now</a></div><figure class="spotlight__image-wrapper image-filter-inherit"><img <div class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container">
<div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-6 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
<div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-shiro-contact contact"><svg width="1em" height="1em" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="contact__icon"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M14.5 5.5a4.5 4.5 0 11-9 0 4.5 4.5 0 019 0zM2 16c0-2 2.083-5 8-5s8 3 8 5v3H2v-3z" fill="#000"></path></svg><h3 class="contact__title">Contact us</h3><div class="contact__description">Questions about the Wikimedia Foundation or our projects? Get in touch with our team.</div><a class="contact__call-to-action" href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/about/contact/">Contact</a><h4 class="contact__social-title">Follow</h4>
<div class="wp-block-buttons is-layout-flex wp-block-buttons-is-layout-flex">

<div class="wp-block-button is-style-as-link has-icon has-icon-social-twitter-blue"><a class="wp-block-button__link wp-element-button" href="https://twitter.com/wikimedia" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Twitter</a></div>

<section class="photo-attribution">
			<h2 class="photo-attribution__heading">Photo credits</h2>
	
	<div class="photo-attribution__inner">
		
<div class="attribution-item">
	<div class="attribution-item__image">
		<img width="63" height="42" src="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/ArtAndFeminism_2017_Livrustkammaren_06-e1533254907593.jpg?w=63" class="attachment-63x63 size-63x63 jetpack-lazy-image" alt="Wikipedia edit-a-thon Art+Feminism at the Royal Armoury in Stockholm" decoding="async" loading="lazy" data-lazy-srcset="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/ArtAndFeminism_2017_Livrustkammaren_06-e1533254907593.jpg 1024w, https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/ArtAndFeminism_2017_Livrustkammaren_06-e1533254907593.jpg?resize=300,200 300w, https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/ArtAndFeminism_2017_Livrustkammaren_06-e1533254907593.jpg?resize=768,512 768w" data-lazy-sizes="(max-width: 63px) 100vw, 63px" data-lazy-src="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/ArtAndFeminism_2017_Livrustkammaren_06-e1533254907593.jpg?w=63&amp;is-pending-load=1" srcset="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" />	</div>

	<div class="attribution-item__content">
		<p>
				<div>
		<a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:ArtAndFeminism_2017_Livrustkammaren_06.jpg" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
			Art+Feminism Wikipedia edit-a-thon		</a>
				<a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/" class="commons-tooltip-wrapper" aria-describedby="commons-tooltip" tabindex="0">

		</a>
			</div>

									<p>Jens Mohr</p>

<footer class="site-footer">
	<div class="site-footer__inner">
		<div class="site-footer__description">
	<img class="site-footer__logo" src="https://wikimediafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Wikimedia_Foundation_registered.png"
		 alt="Wikimedia Foundation"/>
			<p>The Wikimedia Foundation, Inc is a nonprofit charitable organization dedicated to encouraging the growth, development and distribution of free, multilingual content, and to providing the full content of these wiki-based projects to the public free of charge.</p>
	</div>
		<nav class="site-footer__callout-nav"><ul id="menu-footer-under-text" class="site-footer__callout-nav__items"><li id="menu-item-48" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom current-menu-item menu-item-48"><a href="/about/jobs/" aria-current="page">Careers</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-161" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-161"><a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/about/contact/">Contact</a></li>
</ul></nav>		
<div class="site-footer__navigation">

				<div class="site-footer__navigation-section site-footer__navigation-section--footer-projects">
				<h2>Projects</h2>
				<nav class="site-footer__navmenu"><ul><li id="menu-item-29" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-29"><a href="https://www.wikipedia.org/">Wikipedia</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-31" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-31"><a href="https://www.wikibooks.org/">Wikibooks</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-32" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-32"><a href="https://www.wikiversity.org/">Wikiversity</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-36" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-36"><a href="https://www.wikinews.org/">Wikinews</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-38" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-38"><a href="https://www.wiktionary.org/">Wiktionary</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-33" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-33"><a href="https://www.wikisource.org/">Wikisource</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-35" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-35"><a href="https://www.wikiquote.org/">Wikiquote</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-37" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-37"><a href="https://www.wikivoyage.org/">Wikivoyage</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-30" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-30"><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/">Wikimedia Commons</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-39" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-39"><a href="https://www.wikidata.org/">Wikidata</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-34" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-34"><a href="https://species.wikimedia.org/">Wikispecies</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-73546" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-73546"><a href="https://www.wikifunctions.org/">Wikifunctions</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-40" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-40"><a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/">MediaWiki</a></li>
</ul></nav>			</div>
						<div class="site-footer__navigation-section site-footer__navigation-section--footer-affiliates">
				<h2>Movement Affiliates</h2>
				<nav class="site-footer__navmenu"><ul><li id="menu-item-41" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-41"><a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Wikimedia_chapters">Wikimedia Chapters</a></li>

</ul></nav>			</div>
						<div class="site-footer__navigation-section site-footer__navigation-section--footer-legal">
				<h2>Other</h2>

	var _paq = window._paq = window._paq || [];
	/* tracker methods like "setCustomDimension" should be called before "trackPageView" */
	_paq.push(['trackPageView']);
	_paq.push(['enableLinkTracking']);
	(function() {
	var u="//piwik.wikimedia.org/";
	_paq.push(['setTrackerUrl', u+'piwik.php']);
	_paq.push(['setSiteId', '17']);
	var d=document, g=d.createElement('script'), s=d.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; g.type='text/javascript'; g.async=true; g.src=u+'piwik.js'; s.parentNode.insertBefore(g,s);
	})();
	</script>
	<!-- End Matomo Code -->

            /* <![CDATA[ */
           document.querySelectorAll("ul.nav-menu").forEach(
               ulist => { 
                    if (ulist.querySelectorAll("li").length == 0) {
                        ulist.style.display = "none";

                                            } 
                }
           );
